About Me

Hi, I'm Jing-Zhong Wang.

My research is primarily focused on Biostatistics and Epidemiology. I am fascinated by the intersection of data science and public health—specifically, how statistical models can help us understand and address health burdens and inequalities.

With a background in Public Health from NTU, I enjoy exploring Bayesian hierarchical modeling and high-dimensional mediation analysis to uncover the hidden stories behind data.

Research Interests

Spatial Analysis Temporal Modeling Health Inequalities Life Expectancy Burden of Disease Populational Epidemiology
